Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

| Disease |
| --- |
| HL60 cells |

Explanation:

HL60 cells are a type of human promyelocytic leukemia cells that are commonly used in scientific research as a model system for studying leukemia and other blood disorders. Therefore, it can be considered as a disease entity.

On the other hand, human bone marrow progenitor (HBMP) cells are not a disease but rather a type of stem cell found in the bone marrow that can differentiate into various types of blood cells. Therefore, it is not considered a disease entity.
